plugins.name: Case Shifter
plugins.description:
Overview

Streamline your design workflow with the Frame Renamer plugin for Figma! This tool allows you to quickly and efficiently rename frame names, making it especially useful when organizing and exporting layers.


Features

  1. Quick Rename: Easily rename frames in bulk, saving time and effort.
  2. Organize Layers: Keep your Figma projects neat and well-organized by using consistent naming conventions.
  3. Efficient Exporting: Simplify your exporting process by standardizing layer names, reducing errors and improving efficiency.


Supported Naming Conventions

The Frame Renamer currently supports the following cases:

  1. camelCase: e.g., frameNameExample
  2. snake_case: e.g., frame_name_example
  3. kebab-case: e.g., frame-name-example
  4. PascalCase: e.g., FrameNameExample


Future Updates

We are continually working to improve the Frame Renamer plugin. Stay tuned for more features and naming conventions in future updates!
plugins.tagline: Transform your Layer name, one case at a time.

101569.name: Case Shifter
101569.description:

plugins.name: Quick Variant
plugins.description:
Allows designers to quickly cycle through component variants for selected instances. With simple commands, you can switch to the next or previous variant of a component, streamlining your design workflow.


Key features


  1. Rapidly explore different component states without manual swapping
  2. Efficiently test various design options in context
  3. Seamlessly navigate complex component sets
  4. Boost productivity when working with design systems


Perfect for designers who frequently work with component variants and want to speed up their iteration process.
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to swap variants of components

plugins.name: Filler
plugins.description:
A simple data safe lorem ipsum generator, that let's you be specific about the type and length of content to add.


How to use


Launch the plugin with the full ui, or keep it as a quick action from the command panel, either way goes. Enter the amount of sentences words or paragraphs to insert and hit enter!


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

accepted.name: Luis Ouriach
accepted.description:
Design & community @figmadesign. I write a newsletter, manage and host @8pxmag. 

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, generate

You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: SVG Export no Fill
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to export SVG icons from Figma without the fill attribute, making it easy to modify the icon colors later. You can upload the SVG files to platforms like Elementor or use them with CSS to easily change icon colors via the interface or stylesheets.

Ideal for developers who need reusable, customizable icons that can be easily adapted in various projects.
plugins.tagline: Export SVG icons without fill for easy CSS styling

130213.name: SVG Export no Fill
130213.description:
This plugin allows you to export SVG icons from Figma without the fill attribute, making it easy to modify the icon colors later. You can upload the SVG files to platforms like Elementor or use them with CSS to easily change icon colors via the interface or stylesheets.

Ideal for developers who need reusable, customizable icons that can be easily adapted in various projects.
130213.tagline: Export SVG icons without fill for easy CSS styling

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

127368.description:

Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation

  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed

plugins.name: xps.to.design ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS ‚Äî Import XPS documents (.xps and .oxps)
plugins.description:
Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs.


Convert any XPS document into Figma designs. Import your XPS into Figma as designs with fully editable text layers, or as static, pixel-perfect images.


How to import XPS documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, xps.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúImport‚Äù
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use xps.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your XPSs and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Collaborate on XPS documents with your team in Figma.
  3. Use XPS as templates for new designs in Figma.
  4. And much more!


FREE

  1. 5 imports
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: Duplication
plugins.description:
Figma Duplication Plugin

What It Does

The Figma Duplication Plugin is designed to create multiple copies of a selected frame, automatically populating text fields with data from a CSV file. Key features include:


  1. Bulk Duplication: Create multiple copies of a selected frame
  2. Dynamic Text Replacement: Update text content in each duplicate using CSV data
  3. Organized Layout: Automatically arrange duplicates in a grid layout within a new section

How To Use It

  1. Select a Frame: First, select the frame you want to duplicate in your Figma file.


  1. Launch the Plugin: Open the Duplication Plugin from your plugins panel.


Configure Settings:

  1. Enter the number of copies you want to create
  2. Select which text layers you want to modify (you can add multiple)
  3. Upload a CSV file containing the data for text replacement

CSV Format Requirements:


  1. The CSV headers must exactly match the names of the text layers you want to modify
  2. Each row represents data for one duplicate
  3. The plugin will read values from the columns corresponding to your selected text layers
  4. Click Submit: The plugin will create your duplicates in a new section with all text fields updated according to your CSV data.


Limitations

  1. Works only with frames containing text layers
  2. CSV headers must exactly match the text layer names


This plugin is ideal for creating multiple versions of components that differ only in text content, such as cards, buttons, or profile items with different data
plugins.tagline: Tired of filling in your data? just use this ! :D

127056.name: Duplication
127056.description:
Figma Duplication Plugin

  2. Each row represents data for one duplicate

  4. Click Submit: The plugin will create your duplicates in a new section with all text fields updated according to your CSV data.

This plugin is ideal for creating multiple versions of components that differ only in text content, such as cards, buttons, or profile items with different data
127056.tagline: Tired of filling in your data? just use this ! :D

plugins.name: Standardized icon
plugins.description:
This plugin can help you complete the standardization process after drawing icons and also enables the inheritance of color replacement for icon components.

1. Select the frame, then click [Standardize].

2. Generate the desired icon size.

It is recommended to watch this tutorial before using the plugin

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1fB4y1G7TU/?spm_id_from=333.1387.search.video_card.click&vd_source=7989179b8f671e578572baf26d6ffb66

126949.release_notes: Fixed the issue where internal elements lacked constraints when generating icons.

plugins.name: Private Notes
plugins.description:
Private Notes allows you to attach personal annotations to any layer in your Figma file that remain completely private to you.


  1. Truly Private: Notes are stored locally and their contents are only visible to you, never to other collaborators
  2. Visual Markers: Customisable markers show where you've left notes (only visible when you run the plugin)
  3. Flexible Positioning: Place note markers in 8 different positions around your layers that stay fixed to the right frame.
  4. Persistent Storage: Your notes remain attached to layers even when you close and reopen Figma


Perfect for designers who want to keep track of personal thoughts, reminders, and to-dos without cluttering the file with comments visible to everyone.


Use it for recording client feedback, noting implementation details, or leaving yourself breadcrumbs for areas that need further attention.


Please contact me for any feedback. suggestions or issues!
plugins.tagline: Keep your thoughts private- annotations only you can see.

plugins.name: Text Styles from CSV
plugins.description:
**Text Styles from CSV** is a Figma plugin that allows users to import text styles directly from a CSV file, saving time and ensuring consistency across projects.


### ‚ú® Features:

- üìÇ Import text styles from a CSV file with one click.

- üî† Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- üé® Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ‚ö° Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### üìå How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
plugins.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

### ‚ú® Features:

- üî† Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- üé® Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ‚ö° Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### üìå How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
120678.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File üìÇ: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants üé®: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components üöÄ: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

120235.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
120235.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File üìÇ: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants üé®: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components üöÄ: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.

networkAccess.reasoning: Required to load feedback data from online spreadsheet

120235.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

plugins.name: ARBFromDesign
plugins.description: Streamline your localization workflow with the ARBFromDesign plugin for Figma. This tool automatically extracts text from your Figma frames and generates ARB (Application Resource Bundle) entries in camelCase format, ready for translation. The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.

plugins.name: SVG Exporter
plugins.description:
Este plugin te permite exportar elementos gr√°ficos (assets) en formato SVG desde cualquier Frame que selecciones en Figma. Al ejecutarlo:

1. El plugin detecta autom√°ticamente los vectores, √≠conos y componentes dentro del frame seleccionado.

2. Muestra una lista con vista previa de cada asset, su nombre y tipo (VECTOR, LINE, COMPONENT, etc.).

3. Puedes filtrar por tipo, seleccionar o deseleccionar assets individualmente o todos a la vez.

4. Al hacer clic en ‚ÄúExportar selecci√≥n‚Äù, los archivos se descargan en un ZIP listo para usar.


Uso paso a paso:

‚Ä¢ Selecciona un Frame que contenga los assets que deseas exportar.

‚Ä¢ Ejecuta el plugin.

‚Ä¢ Filtra, selecciona y exporta.


Limitaciones actuales:

‚Ä¢ Solo funciona si seleccionas un Frame (no soporta m√∫ltiples frames a la vez).

‚Ä¢ Solo exporta elementos compatibles con formato SVG.

‚Ä¢ No incluye im√°genes rasterizadas, texto plano ni auto layout como exportables.

‚Ä¢ No detecta autom√°ticamente cambios de selecci√≥n; requiere usar el bot√≥n ‚ÄúActualizar selecci√≥n‚Äù.



-----------------------------------------


This plugin lets you export graphical elements (assets) as SVG files from any selected Frame in Figma.


When you run the plugin:

1. It scans the selected frame for valid exportable elements (e.g., VECTORS, ICONS, COMPONENTS).

2. You‚Äôll see a list of assets with preview thumbnails, names, and their Figma types.

3. You can filter by type, toggle selection, and bulk-select assets.

4. Clicking ‚ÄúExport Selection‚Äù downloads all selected assets as a clean ZIP file of SVGs.


How to use it:

‚Ä¢ Select a Frame that contains the assets you want to export.

‚Ä¢ Launch the plugin.

‚Ä¢ Use the filters, select assets, and export.


Current limitations:

‚Ä¢ Only one Frame can be selected at a time.

‚Ä¢ Only elements that support SVG export will be included (e.g., no bitmaps or text layers).

‚Ä¢ Does not automatically react to new selections ‚Äî use the ‚ÄúRefresh Selection‚Äù button manually when needed.
plugins.tagline: Exporta f√°cilmente assets SVG desde frames seleccionados en Figma, con vista previa y filtros.

3. Puedes filtrar por tipo, seleccionar o deseleccionar assets individualmente o todos a la vez.

4. Al hacer clic en ‚ÄúExportar selecci√≥n‚Äù, los archivos se descargan en un ZIP listo para usar.

‚Ä¢ No detecta autom√°ticamente cambios de selecci√≥n; requiere usar el bot√≥n ‚ÄúActualizar selecci√≥n‚Äù.



-----------------------------------------

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI ‚Äî just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

122826.name: i18n JSON exporter
122826.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
122826.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: LinkrUI
plugins.description: LinkrUI gives you access to a wide range of digital asset management systems and file storage systems from within Figma Design‚Ñ¢ and Figma Jam‚Ñ¢. You can place your assets and archive your Figma work to your DAM or storage system.

133230.description: LinkrUI gives you access to a wide range of digital asset management systems and file storage systems from within Figma Design‚Ñ¢ and Figma Jam‚Ñ¢. You can place your assets and archive your Figma work to your DAM or storage system.

133230.tagline: Access your assets within Figma Design, Figma Jam

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

117679.name: Protoboi
117679.description:

plugins.name: Quick Layout Calculator
plugins.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. Perfect for design system maintainers and UI developers who need quick spacing verification without manual guides. Select a frame, click "Show Spacing" to display distances, and "Hide Spacing" to remove them. Works with all layer types and keeps your design clean by focusing on nearby elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick Layout Calculator: Instantly reveal spacing between elements with clear, pixelmeasurements.

115126.name: Quick Layout Calculator
115126.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. Perfect for design system maintainers and UI developers who need quick spacing verification without manual guides. Select a frame, click "Show Spacing" to display distances, and "Hide Spacing" to remove them. Works with all layer types and keeps your design clean by focusing on nearby elements.
115126.tagline: Quick Layout Calculator: Instantly reveal spacing between elements with clear, pixelmeasurements.

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer‚Äôs name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic üòâ)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix ‚Äúexclude-‚Äù to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


üñ§ Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


üí¨ Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I‚Äôd love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
üëã Hi! 
I‚Äôm a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.
